root: ^!I’ve never seen the Coffee Fork so packed. I spot familiar faces from our last concert, sipping on caffeinated beverages of choice. A couple of people are setting up onstage.
^!I beeline to the back of Coffee Fork, searching for Madi. I find her talking to, what seems like, the band organizer in a frustrated manner.
^!When she sees me, she waves the band organizer away.
^@Wouldn’t miss it for the world, man.
^^The closing act is Jonathan Jones and the Speakeasy Choir…
^^We need someone to fill their spot…
^^Thank you. I owe you big time.
^!I return to the seating area, settling back into my seat and watching the show start. The house is packed now, with a few people even standing outside to watch. What have I gotten myself into?
^!Madi takes the stage to a roar of applause from the crowd. She grabs the mic and addresses us all.

^^Uh… thank you, everyone. For coming out tonight. We have a jam packed roster of amazing local talent who you might already know or maybe have seen before and would like to see again and I’m rambling now sorry.

^!A young man with bright green hair makes his way onto the stage, hitting the crowd with a heavy, inaccessible synth bass layered under drum samples and clips from science fiction shows played in reverse. The crowd screams.
^!After his set, Madi introduces the next band, the Third Waves. A group of three ladies make their way on stage, playing original punk rock songs.
^!As each act leaves the stage, I get more and more nervous.
^!Out of nowhere, Madi sits down next to me.
^^Alright, just making sure. I know you’re gonna do great.
^!Madi squeezes my shoulder and jogs back up to the stage.
^^Everybody, we’re down to the last act of the night.
^^Now this person, who is my friend, is making their first live stage appearance. Please welcome, Ska Revived!
^!Everyone cheers as I take the stage.
^@Uh, hey everybody. Good to be here. Thanks for having me on. Great crowd.
^!The crowd claps politely. I sit down at the piano.
^!I work my magic and play the most mediocre piano I’ve ever heard in my life. I play a Ska song, a band I was a part of in my high school years, based on muscle memory.
^!I look up at the crowd. I see a bunch of people shifting in their seats. Oh no, I’m losing them.

^!Like an angel descending from heaven, Madi walks onstage, playing the guitar. We lock eyes and she gives me a reassuring smile as she effortlessly plays the chords to the song. I look out and see the crowd go wild to Madi’s appearance on stage. Everyone’s bouncing now.
^!It fills me with renewed energy as we jump into the chorus.
^!Madi jumps into an improvised solo that was WAY better than the one written from our guitarist in high school.
^!We make it to the end of the song in one piece and the crowd goes wild. They chant Madi’s name.
^!I excuse myself from the stage and take my seat as Madi cozies up to the microphone.
^^Hey everyone. I haven’t played in front of people in a long time… but it’s cool to be back.
^^This goes out to a good friend… who helped me to be able to do this again.
^!Madi locks eyes with me. We both smile.
^!Madi closes her eyes and starts playing an upbeat, intricate melody. The crowd sways to the music.
^!After she finishes the song, the crowd erupts in a final cheer. She thanks everyone for coming out.
^!The moment she steps offstage, she gets mobbed by people. Everyone seems to be amazed that she’s playing again.
^!I wait for everyone to praise Madi, and soon enough, people funnel out of the coffee shop.
^@Thanks for saving me from myself up there.
^^All in all it ended up being pretty cute. Plus you protected us from Jonatahn Jones and the Speakeasy Choir.
^@Did it feel good to be on stage again?
^^Yeah, it really did. I stopped playing after my husband died.
^^Crowds make me nervous as all hell… But when I was with Richard… he lit up the room. I could follow his lead. After he passed… I was lost. Even touching a guitar hurt too much.
^^I guess what I’m trying to say is… life wasn’t this scary when I had someone in my corner. Someone I felt safe with… I um… hadn’t felt like that in a long time…
^^When I saw you looking so scared on stage, you reminded me of myself. And I don’t want anyone else to have to feel that bad.

^^But when I got up there and started playing, for the first time in forever, I felt comfortable. Your strength gave me strength. Whether you were trying or not, you got me out of my comfort zone. So… thank you.
^@I’m glad I could help. You coming onstage… I didn’t think you would stick your neck out for me like that. Especially considering… all of this.
^@That really means a lot to me.
^^Well… you mean a lot to me.
^!She leans in and kisses me, quick and soft. She pulls away and covers her mouth.
^^Oh god! I’m sorry! I… uh… Sorry I can’t believe I just did that.
^@Neither can I, but I’m glad you did.
^@Yes… I think we make a pretty good team.
